page.title: 02SNOWDOWN COLLIERY.
page.content: Snowdown Colliery covers an area of seventy acres. At the moment there are two hundred and sixty_two workmen and twenty_one staff. There are three shafts on the site. The number one shaft, which was sunk to a depth of 82.6m. encountered water bearing chalk and today is used as a water reservoir from which water is pumped and used for firefighting and bathing. Shaft No.2 was sunk to a depth of 940m. and No.3 to 912m. The shafts sunk at Snowdown first reached workable coal in 1912. Most of the coal is used in the making of electricity, the steel industry and the cement industry. In March 1984 production at Snowdown was halted due to a national miner's strike which lasted well over a year.
